items.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns amid corruption probe as Russia-Ukraine war rages on
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after his home was raided as part of a corruption investigation involving the energy sector. Retired Lt. Gen. Ben Hodges joins CBS News with more.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after his home was raided as part of a corruption investigation involving the energy sector. Retired Lt. Gen. Ben Hodges joins CBS News with more.

items.title: Zelensky's top adviser resigns after Ukrainian anti-corruption raid on his home
items.standfirst: Andriy Yermak, 54, has been the Ukrainian president's chief of staff throughout Russia's full-scale war.
items.content: Andriy Yermak, 54, has been the Ukrainian president's chief of staff throughout Russia's full-scale war.

items.title: Zelenskyy’s top aide quits after anti-corruption searches of his home
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy chief of staff resigns after property raid by Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies – Europe live
items.standfirst: ‘I want there to be no rumours and speculation,’ Zelenskyy says as Andriy Yermak resignsThe Commission also totally rejected dismissed Russia’s criticism of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as “illegitimate” leader of Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin suggested yesterday that was a technical reason he couldn’t agree a peace deal with Zelenskyy.“President Zelensky is the democratically elected president, by the Ukrainian people, of Ukraine,” a commission spokesperson said in response, somewhat mockingly adding that Putin seems to have “some difficulties in recognising the democratically elected president of his neighbour country, Ukraine.”“Let me stress the fight against corruption is a key element for a country to join the EU, it requires continuous efforts and a strong capacity to fight corruption. This is a key element that we also address in our enlargement report that was published a couple of weeks ago, so we will continue to follow the situation very closely.” Continue reading...
items.content: ‘I want there to be no rumours and speculation,’ Zelenskyy says as Andriy Yermak resignsThe Commission also totally rejected dismissed Russia’s criticism of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as “illegitimate” leader of Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin suggested yesterday that was a technical reason he couldn’t agree a peace deal with Zelenskyy.“President Zelensky is the democratically elected president, by the Ukrainian people, of Ukraine,” a commission spokesperson said in response, somewhat mockingly adding that Putin seems to have “some difficulties in recognising the democratically elected president of his neighbour country, Ukraine.”“Let me stress the fight against corruption is a key element for a country to join the EU, it requires continuous efforts and a strong capacity to fight corruption. This is a key element that we also address in our enlargement report that was published a couple of weeks ago, so we will continue to follow the situation very closely.” Continue reading...

items.title: Top Zelenskyy aide quits amid corruption probe

items.content: Resignation of chief of staff and negotiator Andriy Yermak adds to trouble for beleaguered Ukrainian president

items.title: Zelenskyy will cut a lonely figure without his towering chief of staff
items.standfirst: The loss of Volodymyr Zelenskyy's closest aide is a huge personal blow for the Ukrainian president, and could well weaken his authority.
items.content: The loss of Volodymyr Zelenskyy's closest aide is a huge personal blow for the Ukrainian president, and could well weaken his authority.

items.title: Zelensky says his chief of staff Andriy Yermak has resigned after anti-graft raids
items.standfirst: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Friday that his chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, has submitted his resignation amid a corruption scandal. Ukrainian anti-corruption agencies searched Yermak's home in the morning. Meanwhile, Kyiv hit Russia's Saratov oil refinery and the Saky air base in occupied Crimea overnight, the Ukrainian military said Friday. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments. France24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg has the latest.
items.content: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Friday that his chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, has submitted his resignation amid a corruption scandal. Ukrainian anti-corruption agencies searched Yermak's home in the morning. Meanwhile, Kyiv hit Russia's Saratov oil refinery and the Saky air base in occupied Crimea overnight, the Ukrainian military said Friday. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments. France24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg has the latest.

items.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns as Ukraine corruption investigations widen
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.(Image credit: Martial Trezzini/AP)

items.title: Zelensky dismisses top aid Andriy Yermak as corruption investigation widens
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, resigned Friday after anti-corruption investigators searched his apartment and office in Kyiv. The move comes as Ukraine faces intense US pressure to reach a peace deal with Russia and seeks to demonstrate its commitment to fighting corruption to the European Union.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, resigned Friday after anti-corruption investigators searched his apartment and office in Kyiv. The move comes as Ukraine faces intense US pressure to reach a peace deal with Russia and seeks to demonstrate its commitment to fighting corruption to the European Union.

items.title: Zelenskyy’s top aide resigns after search by anticorruption investigators
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president says chief of staff Andriy Yermak has submitted his resignation amid wide-scale corruption inquiry.
items.content: Ukrainian president says chief of staff Andriy Yermak has submitted his resignation amid wide-scale corruption inquiry.

items.title: Top Zelenskyy aide at heart of U.S. peace talks resigns after being implicated in corruption probe
items.standfirst: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war
items.content: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war

ai_summary: Andriy Yermak resigned as Ukraine's chief of staff after anti-corruption searches.
The investigation involves the energy sector and potential corruption allegations.
Yermak had been a key figure in peace talks with the United States.
His departure was announced by President Zelenskyy in a social media video.
The resignation follows a raid on Yermak's home by anti-corruption agencies.

clusters.title: Officials told to pause all asylum decisions in wake of National Guard shooting
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Orders Immigration Halt After National Guard Shooting

items.title: Officials told to pause all asylum decisions in wake of National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Friday directed officials to pause all asylum decisions in the wake of the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington, D.C.
items.content: The Trump administration on Friday directed officials to pause all asylum decisions in the wake of the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington, D.C.

items.title: Trump vows 'permanent pause' on some immigration after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.
items.content: After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries. (Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)

items.title: Investigators probe suspect's background in D.C. National Guard shooting

items.content: A National Guard member died in the wake of the shooting near the White House, President Trump said.

items.title: Sarah Beckstrom's Ex-Boyfriend Reacts to DC Shooting: 'Loved Her to Pieces'
items.standfirst: The ex-boyfriend of National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom said he “loved her to pieces” after she was fatally shot in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday. “I loved her to pieces,” Adam Carr, who said he dated Beckstrom for six years, told CNN. “She never deserved any of that. I always wished the…

items.content: BBC Verify looks into claims that the Afghan national suspected of shooting two National Guard members in Washington DC entered the US unvetted.

items.title: Trump says he will suspend immigration from all "Third World Countries"
items.standfirst: In a social media post, President Trump wrote that he "will permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the U.S. system to fully recover."
items.content: In a social media post, President Trump wrote that he "will permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the U.S. system to fully recover."

items.title: WATCH: ‘Are you stupid?’ Trump rebuffs reporter’s question on Afghan resettlement vetting
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump called a journalist "stupid" for attempting to fact-check his claim that the Biden administration didn’t vet Afghan nationals who came to the United States, related to the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington.
items.content: President Donald Trump called a journalist "stupid" for attempting to fact-check his claim that the Biden administration didn’t vet Afghan nationals who came to the United States, related to the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington.

items.title: National Guard shooting suspect faces upgraded first-degree murder charge
items.standfirst: Specialist Sarah Beckstrom, 20, and Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe, 24 were hospitalized in critical condition after the Wednesday afternoon shooting near the White House. Trump announced Thursday evening that Beckstrom had died.
items.content: Specialist Sarah Beckstrom, 20, and Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe, 24 were hospitalized in critical condition after the Wednesday afternoon shooting near the White House. Trump announced Thursday evening that Beckstrom had died.

items.title: D.C. National Guard shooting suspect worked with CIA in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: A 29-year-old Afghan national named Rahmanullah Lakanwal has been identified as the suspected shooter in the ambush that killed one National Guard member and wounded another in D.C., officials say.
items.content: A 29-year-old Afghan national named Rahmanullah Lakanwal has been identified as the suspected shooter in the ambush that killed one National Guard member and wounded another in D.C., officials say.

items.title: National Guard ambush shooting suspect facing murder charge after victim dies
items.standfirst: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the Afghan national suspected of shooting two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, will face a murder charge after Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died, U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro said. CBS News' Nicole Sganga and Weijia Jiang report.
items.content: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the Afghan national suspected of shooting two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, will face a murder charge after Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died, U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro said. CBS News' Nicole Sganga and Weijia Jiang report.

items.content: US president orders halt to arrivals from ‘Third World’ countries and sweeping review of legal permanent residents

items.title: Second National Guard member shot in D.C. is "fighting for his life," Trump says
items.standfirst: President Trump said Thursday evening that Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died from her injuries in the Washington, D.C., shooting, and Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was "fighting for his life."
items.content: President Trump said Thursday evening that Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died from her injuries in the Washington, D.C., shooting, and Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was "fighting for his life."

items.title: Trump slams immigration from "Third World Countries" and threatens to suspend Biden-era admissions
items.standfirst: President Trump posted on social media, threatening to halt immigration from "Third World Countries" and migrant admissions from the previous administration. CBS News' Weijia Jiang reports.
items.content: President Trump posted on social media, threatening to halt immigration from "Third World Countries" and migrant admissions from the previous administration. CBS News' Weijia Jiang reports.

items.title: National Guard member "fighting for his life" as nation mourns Sarah Beckstrom's death
items.standfirst: President Trump announced Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died after being shot during an ambush shooting in Washington, D.C. Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe remains in critical condition, U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro said. CBS News' Nicole Sganga reports.
items.content: President Trump announced Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died after being shot during an ambush shooting in Washington, D.C. Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe remains in critical condition, U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro said. CBS News' Nicole Sganga reports.

items.title: Suspect in Washington, DC, shooting charged with murder after soldier dies

items.content: US attorney files new charge against Rahmanullah Lakanwal after National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom dies from wounds.

items.title: National Guard member dies after shooting in Washington DC
items.standfirst: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, succumbed to her injuries, while a second guardsman remains in critical condition, Donald Trump says.
items.content: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, succumbed to her injuries, while a second guardsman remains in critical condition, Donald Trump says.

items.title: Trump says US will pause migration from 'third-world countries'
items.standfirst: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.
items.content: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.

items.title: National Guard member dies from injuries. And, death toll in Hong Kong fire rises
items.standfirst: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-rise fire rises as dozens remain missing.
items.content: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-rise fire rises as dozens remain missing.(Image credit: Andrew Leyden)

items.title: Trump vows permanent pause on migration from 'third world countries' after D.C. shooting
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec
items.content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec

items.title: What we know about shooting of National Guard in Washington DC
items.standfirst: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.
items.content: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.

items.title: Trump admin. pauses immigration applications from Afghans after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: Federal immigration authorities said Wednesday they have paused processing requests from Afghan nationals, after a man from Afghanistan was identified as the suspect in the D.C. National Guard shooting.
items.content: Federal immigration authorities said Wednesday they have paused processing requests from Afghan nationals, after a man from Afghanistan was identified as the suspect in the D.C. National Guard shooting.

items.title: Trump administration orders green card "reexamination" from "countries of concern"
items.standfirst: The review comes after an Afghan national who arrived in the U.S. in 2021 was arrested in the shooting of two National Guard members.
items.content: The review comes after an Afghan national who arrived in the U.S. in 2021 was arrested in the shooting of two National Guard members.

items.title: U.S. to re-examine green card holders from 19 countries 'of concern'
items.standfirst: The announcement comes a day after an attack on National Guard troops near the White House. Authorities have identified the suspect as an Afghan national.
items.content: The announcement comes a day after an attack on National Guard troops near the White House. Authorities have identified the suspect as an Afghan national.

items.title: Watch: How the shooting of two National Guard members unfolded
items.standfirst: The two soldiers are in critical condition after being attacked blocks from the White House in Washington DC.
items.content: The two soldiers are in critical condition after being attacked blocks from the White House in Washington DC.

ai_summary: Officials were told to pause asylum decisions after a National Guard shooting.
The alleged shooter was identified as an Afghan national, Rahmanullah Lakanwal.
Trump vowed to permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.
A National Guard member died in the shooting near the White House.
Trump ordered a review of green cards held by immigrants from 19 nations.

items.title: Around 6,000 Planes Impacted as Airbus Requests Software Update

The affected aircraft, among the most widely flown…

items.title: Airbus warns of travel disruption as thousands of planes require urgent software fix
items.standfirst: Airbus urged airlines on Friday to take "immediate precautionary action" after identifying a software flaw affecting thousands of A320-family aircraft and warning of travel disruption as carriers roll out the fix. The alert follows an incident on a JetBlue flight in October when a software malfunction caused the plane to abruptly nosedive.
items.content: Airbus urged airlines on Friday to take "immediate precautionary action" after identifying a software flaw affecting thousands of A320-family aircraft and warning of travel disruption as carriers roll out the fix. The alert follows an incident on a JetBlue flight in October when a software malfunction caused the plane to abruptly nosedive.

items.title: Airbus Warns A320 Fleet Needs Software Fix After Incident

items.content: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.

ai_summary: Airbus is requiring an urgent software fix for A320 family jets.
The update addresses potential data corruption from intense solar radiation.
Several airlines anticipate varying levels of disruption due to the fix.
The recall could impact hundreds of planes in the United States.
The software change must be completed before the next routine flight.

items.title: Hong Kong fire death toll rises to 128, with 200 still missing and 8 more arrested

clusters.title: Zuma's daughter quits South African parliament amid war recruitment claims
clusters.neutral_headline: Zuma's Daughter Resigns Amid War Recruitment Claims

items.title: Zuma's daughter quits South African parliament amid war recruitment claims
items.standfirst: A daughter of South Africa's ex-president Jacob Zuma has resigned from parliament after claims she was involved in recruiting men to join Russian mercenaries in the Ukraine war, her party said Friday. Police last week said they were investigating allegations that Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla, an MP in her father's Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) party, had lured 17 South African men to Russia "to fight in the Ukrainian war without their knowledge or consent".
items.content: A daughter of South Africa's ex-president Jacob Zuma has resigned from parliament after claims she was involved in recruiting men to join Russian mercenaries in the Ukraine war, her party said Friday. Police last week said they were investigating allegations that Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla, an MP in her father's Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) party, had lured 17 South African men to Russia "to fight in the Ukrainian war without their knowledge or consent".

items.title: Jacob Zuma’s daughter resigns amid claims South Africans tricked to fight for Russia
items.standfirst: Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla quits as MP after being accused of recruiting 17 men who are trapped in war-torn UkraineA daughter of the former South African president Jacob Zuma has resigned as an MP, after being accused of tricking 17 South African men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia to train as bodyguards for the Zumas’ uMkhonto weSizwe (MK) party.Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla, 43, the most visible and active in politics of her siblings, volunteered to resign and step back from public roles while cooperating with a police investigation and working to bring the men home, the MK chair, Nkosinathi Nhleko, said at a press conference in Durban. Continue reading...
items.content: Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla quits as MP after being accused of recruiting 17 men who are trapped in war-torn UkraineA daughter of the former South African president Jacob Zuma has resigned as an MP, after being accused of tricking 17 South African men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia to train as bodyguards for the Zumas’ uMkhonto weSizwe (MK) party.Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla, 43, the most visible and active in politics of her siblings, volunteered to resign and step back from public roles while cooperating with a police investigation and working to bring the men home, the MK chair, Nkosinathi Nhleko, said at a press conference in Durban. Continue reading...

items.title: Damascus blasts Israeli war crime : At least 10 killed
items.standfirst: At least 13 people, including two children, were killed and 25 injured as Israel carried out another incursion into Syrian territory in the Damascus countryside, according to state media, which also reported that several Israeli soldiers were wounded in the clashes. The dawn raid and accompanying strikes forced dozens of families to flee the town of Beit Jinn for safer nearby areas. Camille Knight reports.
items.content: At least 13 people, including two children, were killed and 25 injured as Israel carried out another incursion into Syrian territory in the Damascus countryside, according to state media, which also reported that several Israeli soldiers were wounded in the clashes. The dawn raid and accompanying strikes forced dozens of families to flee the town of Beit Jinn for safer nearby areas. Camille Knight reports.

ai_summary: Israeli forces launched an attack on Syria, causing casualties.
The attack occurred in the Damascus countryside.
At least 13 people, including children, were killed.
Approximately 25 people were reported injured.
The raid forced families to flee the town of Beit Jinn.

clusters.title: Opposition NDP party claims victory in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
clusters.neutral_headline: Opposition Party Claims Victory in Saint Vincent Election

items.title: Opposition NDP party claims victory in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
items.standfirst: New Democratic Party ousts longtime Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves, who has served in office since 2001.
items.content: New Democratic Party ousts longtime Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves, who has served in office since 2001.

items.title: St Vincent opposition party celebrates historic election win
items.standfirst: New Democratic party victory is crushing defeat for Unity Labour, which has held power since 2001The New Democratic party (NDP) in the Caribbean country of St Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) is celebrating a historic landslide victory, taking 14 of 15 seats, according to preliminary results.The decisive vote was a crushing defeat for the Unity Labour party (ULP), which has been in power since 2001. Continue reading...
items.content: New Democratic party victory is crushing defeat for Unity Labour, which has held power since 2001The New Democratic party (NDP) in the Caribbean country of St Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) is celebrating a historic landslide victory, taking 14 of 15 seats, according to preliminary results.The decisive vote was a crushing defeat for the Unity Labour party (ULP), which has been in power since 2001. Continue reading...

items.title: St Vincent prime minister seeks record sixth term in tight election
items.standfirst: Ralph Gonsalves campaigns on strong economy in bid to retain office he has held since 2001Voters in St Vincent and the Grenadines will go to the polls on Thursday with Ralph Gonsalves seeking a record sixth consecutive term as prime minister.The elections are expected to be a tight contest between the ruling Unity Labour party, which has been in power since 2001, and the opposition New Democratic party. In the last election, ULP won nine of 15 seats, but the NDP won the popular vote. Continue reading...
items.content: Ralph Gonsalves campaigns on strong economy in bid to retain office he has held since 2001Voters in St Vincent and the Grenadines will go to the polls on Thursday with Ralph Gonsalves seeking a record sixth consecutive term as prime minister.The elections are expected to be a tight contest between the ruling Unity Labour party, which has been in power since 2001, and the opposition New Democratic party. In the last election, ULP won nine of 15 seats, but the NDP won the popular vote. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The New Democratic Party won the Saint Vincent election.
The NDP ousted Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves.
Gonsalves had been in office since 2001.
The NDP secured a landslide victory in the election.
The Unity Labour Party suffered a crushing defeat.

items.title: Amazon workers warn ‘warp-speed’ AI push threatens democracy and the planet
items.standfirst: A growing number of Amazon employees have signed onto an open letter issuing some dire warnings about the company’s sprint toward AI. The letter, signed by more than 1,000 workers and published this week, calls out Amazon for pushing its AI investments at the expense of the climate and its human…
items.content: A growing number of Amazon employees have signed onto an open letter issuing some dire warnings about the company’s sprint toward AI. The letter, signed by more than 1,000 workers and published this week, calls out Amazon for pushing its AI investments at the expense of the climate and its human…

items.title: More than 1,000 Amazon workers warn rapid AI rollout threatens jobs and climate
items.standfirst: Workers say the firm’s ‘warp-speed’ approach fuels pressure, layoffs and rising emissionsMore than 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter expressing “serious concerns” about AI development, saying that the company’s “all-costs justified, warp speed” approach to the powerful technology will cause damage to “democracy, to our jobs, and to the earth.”The letter, published on Wednesday, was signed by the Amazon workers anonymously, and comes a month after Amazon announced mass layoff plans as it increases adoption of AI in its operations. Continue reading...
items.content: Workers say the firm’s ‘warp-speed’ approach fuels pressure, layoffs and rising emissionsMore than 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter expressing “serious concerns” about AI development, saying that the company’s “all-costs justified, warp speed” approach to the powerful technology will cause damage to “democracy, to our jobs, and to the earth.”The letter, published on Wednesday, was signed by the Amazon workers anonymously, and comes a month after Amazon announced mass layoff plans as it increases adoption of AI in its operations. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Over 1,000 Amazon employees signed an open letter.
The letter expresses concerns about AI development.
Workers criticize Amazon's "warp-speed" approach to AI.
The letter warns of damage to democracy and jobs.
The letter follows Amazon's announcement of layoffs.

clusters.title: Thirteen killed in deadliest Israeli raid for months in southern Syria
clusters.neutral_headline: Thirteen killed in deadliest Israeli raid for months in southern Syria

items.title: Thirteen killed in deadliest Israeli raid for months in southern Syria
items.standfirst: Israel said it was targeting militants in the village of Beit Jinn, but Syria's foreign ministry condemns what it called a "war crime".
items.content: Israel said it was targeting militants in the village of Beit Jinn, but Syria's foreign ministry condemns what it called a "war crime".

items.title: Israeli forces kill at least 10 in southern Syria raid, officials and residents say
items.standfirst: Syria's foreign ministry said in a statement Friday that the attack was "a horrific massacre" and said women and children were among those killed.
items.content: Syria's foreign ministry said in a statement Friday that the attack was "a horrific massacre" and said women and children were among those killed.(Image credit: AP)

ai_summary: Israel conducted a raid in southern Syria.
The raid resulted in at least thirteen fatalities.
Israel stated it targeted militants in Beit Jinn.
Syria's foreign ministry condemned the attack.
The ministry called the raid a "war crime".
